metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: It is also possible to place a loop inside another loop. This is called a nested loop .
content.html: It is also possible to place a loop inside another loop. This is called a nested loop.

content.text: The "inner loop" will be executed one time for each iteration of the "outer loop":
content.html: The "inner loop" will be executed one time for each iteration of the "outer loop":

content.code_html:
// Outer loop
for (int i = 1; i <= 2; i++) {
  System.out.println("Outer: " + i); // Executes 2 times
  
  // Inner loop
  for (int j = 1; j <= 3; j++) {
    System.out.println(" Inner: " + j); // Executes 6 times (2 * 3)
  }
}

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What is the output of the following code? for (int i = 1; i <= 2; i++) { for (int j = 1; j <= 3; j++) { System.out.print(i + "," + j + " "); } }
content.html:
What is the output of the following code?
for (int i = 1; i <= 2; i++) {
  for (int j = 1; j <= 3; j++) {
    System.out.print(i + "," + j + " ");
  }
}

metadata.question: What is the output of the following code?for (int i = 1; i <= 2; i++) {  for (int j = 1; j <= 3; j++) {    System.out.print(i + "," + j + " ");  }}
